author: TN City Desk
title: Mumbai News: With Atal Setu, Pune To Become A Part Of Mumbai; Here's How | Mumbai News, Times Now
text: With Atal Setu, Pune To Become A Part Of Mumbai; Here's How According to Nadir Godrej, with the Atal Setu, Pune will seamlessly integrate with Bombay, bridging the short distance between them and transforming the entire expanse into a vast megalopolis. Pune will become a part of Bombay with the Atal Setu. Photo : ANI Mumbai: In an interview, Nadir Godrej, Managing Director of Godrej Industries, shared insights on Mumbai's evolution and the city's infrastructure expansion, particularly with the inauguration of the Atal Setu bridge. According to him, the Atal Setu significantly expands Mumbai's urban footprint, transitioning it into what Americans term a megalopolis, akin to Boswash‚Äîan extensive urban corridor stretching from Boston to Washington, DC, encompassing New York City. With the Atal Setu, Pune will seamlessly integrate with Bombay, bridging the short distance between them and transforming the entire expanse into a vast megalopolis. As per an [ET Now report](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/markets/expert-view/pune-will-become-a-part-of-bombay-with-the-atal-setu-everything-in-between-will-be-one-huge-megalopolis-nadir-godrej/articleshow/107716697.cms?from=mdr), Godrej highlighted Mumbai's cosmopolitan nature and its historical significance as a global city with a thriving financial hub akin to New York. Reflecting on Mumbai's growth trajectory, Godrej noted the exponential rise in population and urban development over the years. While applauding infrastructural advancements such as the Atal Setu bridge and the forthcoming coastal road, he also expressed concerns about escalating air pollution and urged government intervention to address environmental challenges. According to him, the construction of the Atal Setu bridge will significantly enhance connectivity between Pune and Bombay (Mumbai). Historically, Pune and Bombay have been two distinct cities with some geographical distance between them. However, with the introduction of the Atal Setu bridge, the physical barrier between the two cities is greatly reduced, making travel between them much more accessible and convenient. Mumbai's Trans-Harbour Link In recent news, Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) may kick off bus services on the newly-inaugurated Mumbai Trans Harbour Link (MTHL) or the Atal Setu. Once the proposal is passed, locals willing to experience the longest sea link in India will be able to travel using public transport. In its proposal, NMMT has proposed initiating four services between Nerul and Mantralaya on the bridge. Mumbai's Coastal Road Project Mumbai Coastal Road project aims to establish an access-controlled freeway along the western shoreline of Mumbai, extending from Marine Drive to Dahisar. Phase 1 covering the stretch from Marine Drive to Worli is nearing completion, with 84 per cent progress. The subsequent phase will be from Worli to Versova. Phase 3, from Versova to Dahisar, has recently finalised its contractors, marking a significant step forward in the overall project. [Latest News](https://www.timesnownews.com/latest-news) End of Article Subscribe to our daily Newsletter! [Related News](https://www.timesnownews.com/mumbai) Mumbai Bus Operators Against New School Timings, May Hike Fares by 25-40 Per Cent AI Centre In London Likely To Be Named After Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Mumbai Local Trains To Get Less-Crowded; Major Infra Boost On Cards To Ensure Hassle-Free Travel Wheelchair Unavailable, Air India Passenger Walks For 1 Km; Dies Of Heart Attack Akasa Air Cancels THESE Mumbai-Bengaluru Flights Until March 30

author: Diario de C√°diz
title: El alcalde de C√°diz anuncia m√°s baldeos de las calles a partir del lunes 13 de mayo
text: Las calles de C√°diz, cada vez m√°s sucias debido a las restricciones en el uso del agua que impone la sequ√≠a, pero tambi√©n a la ineficacia de la contrata de limpieza, se baldear√°n m√°s y con mayor frecuencia a partir de la semana que arranca el pr√≥ximo lunes 13 de mayo. As√≠ lo ha anunciado esta ma√±ana el alcalde de C√°diz, Bruno Garc√≠a, tras la Junta de Gobierno Local y antes de firmar el decreto que lo permitir√°. Garc√≠a ha recordado que la pasada semana los ayuntamientos de C√°diz y San Fernando recibieron la autorizaci√≥n especial para poder baldear debido a los problemas para disponer de agua a trav√©s de los pozos y contar con margen suficiente para no superar el consumo por habitante. "A partir de ahora, las calles se podr√°n baldear contribuyendo a que la ciudad est√© m√°s limpia", dijo. Adem√°s, esta autorizaci√≥n permitir√° tambi√©n el riego de plantas en parques y jardines, "aunque no ser√° un riego abundante, sino de supervivencia, para que no mueran", precis√≥. Actualizaci√≥n del mapa de ruidos La Junta de Gobierno Local ha adjudicado el servicio para la actualizaci√≥n del Mapa de ruidos y el Plan de Acci√≥n contra el ruido en la ciudad de C√°diz a la empresa Ibermad Medio Ambiente y Desarrollo SL por un importe de 51.216 euros, contando con seis meses para hacer este trabajo. Esta acci√≥n se encontraba dentro de la estrategia Edusi aunque, al no poder acometerse a tiempo, va a ser financiada por el propio Ayuntamiento de C√°diz. El alcalde ha incidido en que el mapa del ruido actual data del a√±o 2012, por lo que es necesario realizar una actualizaci√≥n para adaptarlo a la situaci√≥n real. Por ello, en primera instancia se va a hacer un trabajo de campo que localice y analice todos los posibles puntos de afecci√≥n para que despu√©s en el Plan contra el ruido vayan incluidas las medidas que se van a poner en marcha para minimizar esta situaci√≥n. Entre otras cosas este diagn√≥stico tambi√©n servir√° para revisar y actualizar las zonas ac√∫sticamente saturadas. "En todos los estudios se va a tener en cuenta la poblaci√≥n afectada", dijo Garc√≠a. Personas sin hogar La Junta de Gobierno Local ha aprobado tambi√©n el contrato de suministro de material para la campa√±a de inclemencias meteorol√≥gicas del Ayuntamiento de C√°diz para personas sin hogar. Se trata del material que se entrega a estas personas con motivo de la campa√±a de fr√≠o en invierno, con sacos de dormir, impermeables, camisetas, guantes y calcetines t√©rmicos; y de la campa√±a de calor en verano, con calzado fresco, protector solar y gorras. Este contrato ser√° de dos a√±os con posibilidad de pr√≥rroga por uno m√°s, siendo el precio de licitaci√≥n de 7.108,76 euros. Ayudas sociales En cuanto a las ayudas sociales, se han aprobado ayudas por valor de 160.894,88 euros, de los cuales 145.784 euros son para 501 ayudas de emergencia social; 10.098 euros para ayudas econ√≥micas familiares; 3.711 euros para ayudas para el pago de la luz; y 1.300 euros para ayudas para el pago del agua. Por otro lado, se han aprobado 5 bonificaciones para pensionistas para el pago de la luz, 2 bonificaciones para pensionistas para el pago del agua, 27 ayudas de cobertura energ√©tica anual, y 10 ayudas de suministros vitales de agua. C√°diz, √∫nica capital andaluza sin Reglamento de Participaci√≥n Ciudadana Por otro lado, el alcalde ha asegurado que se han iniciado los tr√°mites para adaptar el Reglamento de Participaci√≥n Ciudadana a la Ley 7/2017, de 27 de diciembre, de Participaci√≥n Ciudadana de Andaluc√≠a. ‚ÄúEsta cuesti√≥n ya la hemos adelantado a las asociaciones de vecinos de nuestra ciudad, a trav√©s de la Federaci√≥n Vecinos C√°diz‚Äù. El alcalde ha resaltado que ‚Äúse trata de una demanda hist√≥rica de las asociaciones de vecinos que adem√°s es necesaria porque C√°diz es la √∫nica capital de provincia de Andaluc√≠a que a√∫n no est√° adaptada a esta ley‚Äù. Esta medida tiene por objeto la regulaci√≥n del derecho de participaci√≥n ciudadana en la direcci√≥n de los asuntos p√∫blicos tanto auton√≥micos como locales, en condiciones de igualdad, de manera real y efectiva, ya sea directamente o a trav√©s de las entidades de participaci√≥n ciudadana, as√≠ como el fomento de su ejercicio. Para poder llevar a cabo esta adaptaci√≥n se ha contratado la empresa Coglobal, que va a realizar varias tandas de reuniones en distintos bloques con asociaciones y con vecinos. A partir de esas reuniones se redacta el proyecto de Reglamento de Participaci√≥n Ciudadana, cuyo borrador deber√° pasar por el pleno municipal.

author: Jeffrey Rapaport
title: Vibrating Pill Cures Obesity? New Tech Is Sci-Fi Come To Life
text:
Vibrating Pill Cures Obesity? New Tech Is Sci-Fi Come To Life
The latest in the ongoing trend of
sci-fi tropes becoming reality: a vibrating pill developed by MIT scientists significantly curbing obesity. The technology constitutes a groundbreaking development in the fight against weight gain, which the pill purports to reduce. Despite its cutting-edge package, the innovative approach nonetheless draws from an age-old advice: drink a glass of water before meals to feel full.
Scientists hope the technology will revolutionize weight loss strategies and offer an alternative to conventional dieting methods, such as surgery and expensive medications. Simulating the all-familiar sensation of being full is the key concept behind the vibrating pill. Indeed, dieticians have long counseled clients to imbibe a healthy portion of water before eating.
How It Works
The MIT researchers developing the capsule adhered to a similar principle, but one taking a much more direct approach. Specifically, the pill is intended to stimulate the stomach‚Äôs mechanoreceptors. These, in turn, send signals to the brain through the vagus cranial nerve.
Cumulatively, this activation commences the production of various hormones in the brain. These include insulin, GLP-1, C-peptide, and PYY‚Äîall of which collaboratively reduce hunger and enhance the digestion process.
Good news for dieters long disappointed by the fad diets and endless stream of exercise regimes: initial tests of the vibrating pill in laboratory settings led to promising results.
The research team found that animals fed the pill 20 minutes before eating exhibited a reduction in food consumption by 40 percent. Simply put, the high-tech pill‚Äôs ability to leverage and regulate the body‚Äôs endogenous system engenders decreased appetite.
Simulating the all-familiar sensation of being full is the key concept behind the vibrating pill.
Most remarkably, as an associate professor at MIT Giovanni Traverso highlighted, the capsule employs the body‚Äôs innate biology instead of external, potentially harmful agents to promote weight loss.
What emerges is a potentially powerful, even revolutionary tool for treating obesity‚Äîone largely harnessing the human body‚Äôs internal system to achieve improved health.
That being said, the vibrating pill has a slightly disconcerting appearance‚Äîreminiscent of something behind the origin story of a
superhero like Cyborg more than something you pick up at the pharmacy.
A silver oxide battery powers a vibrating motor inside the capsule‚Äîitself the size of a typical multi-vitamin. The pill exhibits novel design and ingenious application: upon reaching the stomach, its outer layer dissolves in the surrounding gastric acid. This process then finalizes the electrical circuit and initiates the vibration.
Of course, following their tests on animals, the scientists behind the pill now focus on ensuring the technology is as safe and feasible for human consumption as possible. As compelling and promising as the vibrating pill‚Äôs efficacy is, it‚Äôs easy to see people reluctant to swallow a miniature motor‚Äìat least until human trials are safely and transparently complete.
The research team found that animals fed the pill 20 minutes before eating exhibited a reduction in food consumption by 40 percent.
Additionally, scaling up production remains a priority and perhaps a challenge. Manufacturing‚Äîof drugs, iPhones, or EVs, for that matter‚Äîoften proves an under appreciated obstacle in tech.
Challenges aside, researchers like post-doc Shriya Srinivasan exhibit optimism; Srinivasan believes the pill could be produced cost-effectively and at an enormous scale.
For its part, the vibrating pill joins a burgeoning trend in medical research, one exploring the possibilities of capsule-based tech. From ingestible sensors to advanced micro-robotic systems, the future increasingly appears characterized by medical treatments reduced to the mere act of swallowing a pill.
Source:
MIT

author: newsdesk@cambridge-news.co.uk (Tom Burnett)
title: What we know so far about Peterborough fire as emergency services attend Padholme Road blaze
text:
Dozens of firefighters are at the scene of a 'large fire' in
Peterborough tonight (Thursday, December 28). Emergency services are attending the blaze on Padholme Road. Cambridgeshire Fire and Rescue Service has said it was called to a fire in the roof of an industrial building. More than 30 firefighters are currently at the scene.
Emergency services were first contacted about the incident at around 8.50pm. Cambridgeshire Police has urged people to avoid the area and those living nearby have been advised to keep doors and windows shut due to smoke rising from the fire.
Live updates:
Updates on the Padholme Road fire in Peterborough as they come in
A Cambridgeshire Police spokesperson said: "Police are assisting Cambs Fire & Rescue Service at a large fire off Padholme Road in Peterborough. Please avoid the area, and keeps doors and windows closed to protect from smoke."
A Cambridgeshire Fire and Rescue Service spokesperson said: "More than 30 firefighters are tackling a fire involving an industrial building on Padholme Road in Peterborough. Crews were called to the scene around 8.50pm reporting a large fire involving the roof. Please avoid the area where possible and keep windows closed if nearby."
Do you want more of the latest Cambridgeshire news as it comes in? Sign up to our dedicated newsletter to make sure you never miss a big story from Cambridge or anywhere else in the county.
You can also sign up to our dedicated Peterborough, Traffic and Crime newsletters for the latest updates on the topics you are most interested in.

author: Empresa Peruana de Servicios Editoriales S. A. EDITORA PER√ö
title: San Mart√≠n en emergencia: Defensa Civil recaba informaci√≥n para conocer nivel de da√±os | Noticias | Agencia Peruana de Noticias Andina
text:
Si bien en los √∫ltimos d√≠as en la regi√≥n San Mart√≠n se han presentado lluvias intensas y hay cierto n√∫mero de personas que han sufrido algunos da√±os y afectaciones, la situaci√≥n se mantiene dentro de lo normal con precipitaciones fuertes por algunas horas pero luego aparece el sol, tambi√©n fuerte.
As√≠ lo expres√≥ Olter Gonzales Sandoval, jefe de la Oficina Regional de Seguridad y Defensa Nacional de la Regi√≥n San Mart√≠n, al ser entrevistado por la Agencia Andina al se√±alar que personal de su sector se ha desplegado a las zonas donde han ocurrido problemas para obtener la informaci√≥n requerida y proceder a la ayuda correspondiente.
En tal sentido, precis√≥ por el momento no se han producido lluvias por encima de lo normal en la presente temporada.
Indic√≥ que al llover intensamente sube el caudal de los r√≠os y no se transita con normalidad y ocurren problemas en viviendas que est√°n en zonas de alto peligro cuyos habitantes, a pesar de las advertencias de Defensa Civil, no se quieren mover.
Lea tambi√©n: [Lluvias en San Mart√≠n: eval√∫an da√±os causados por inundaciones en tres distritos de Lamas ]
" Hoy (jueves) no hemos tenido lluvia, pero ayer llovi√≥ bastante pero luego a las 3 de la tardes sali√≥ un fuerte sol, as√≠ es ac√° en la Selva, en esta temporada, llueve, aumentan los cauces de los r√≠os, se afecta carreteras y viviendas pero el sol vuelve a salir ", expres√≥.
Olter Gonzales dijo que se ha recibido informaci√≥n de casas afectadas por las lluvias y la crecida de las aguas y deslizamientos de tierra en localidades como El Pongo ,Chazuta, San Pablo y zonas aleda√±as pero no se sabe con exactitud lo ocurrido debido a que no hab√≠a forma de llegar a dichas zonas por la crecida de los r√≠os.
Apenas baj√≥ el cauce, el personal de Defensa Civil regional ha viajado a las zonas de donde provienen los reportes para recabar la informaci√≥n en la fichas EDAN (Evaluaci√≥n de Da√±os y An√°lisis de Necesidades) para luego subir los datos al Sinpad (Sistema Nacional de Informaci√≥n para la Prevenci√≥n y Atenci√≥n de Desastres) y enviar la ayuda que se necesita, se√±al√≥ el funcionario.
La informaci√≥n inicial, agreg√≥, que hemos recibido es de unas 50 casas con da√±os, pero no podemos decir si hay afectados o damnificados, eso lo sabremos con exactitud cuando se conozca la informaci√≥n que suban los empadronadores.
Lea tambi√©n: [San Mart√≠n reporta emergencias por lluvias intensas e inundaciones en diversas provincias]
Gonzales Sandoval dijo que tanto la Direcci√≥n Regional de Vivienda como de Transportes se est√°n movilizando para atender las viviendas y v√≠as afectadas al igual que Defensa Civil de los municipios locales y que todos los organismos involucrados " est√°n preparados llevar y entregar los bienes de ayuda humanitaria que se requieran ".
Asimismo, mencion√≥ el trabajo que realiza la Concesionaria IIRSA Norte en la carretera Tarapoto-Yurimaguas v√≠a que qued√≥ bloqueada por el deslizamiento de tierra pero que ya qued√≥ habilitada.
" Hasta el momento no sabemos con exactitud lo que ha ocurrido pero s√≠ conocemos y es lamentable que muchas viviendas est√°n en zonas de riesgo y esto porque lo permiten las autoridades de los municipios que les dan un documento que los reconocen como asentamiento humano ", anot√≥.
El funcionario sostuvo que con ese documento, los pobladores van a las empresas el√©ctricas de su localidad y obtiene su servicio de luz el√©ctrica, con lo cual pr√°cticamente oficializan su estancia en una zona no adecuada.
" Es lamentable que esto ocurra y es responsabilidad de las autoridades que les otorgan permisos para ubicar casas en lugares que son de alto riesgo ", asever√≥ tras indicar que est√°n a la espera de la informaci√≥n que levanten los empadronadores. (FIN) JCB/MAO
M√°s en Andina:
Diversas calles de la ciudad de Yurimaguas se encuentran inundadas debido a las lluvias intensas, de m√°s de diez horas de duraci√≥n, que se registraron entre la noche del martes 26 y ayer mi√©rcoles en Loreto.
?? https://t.co/4EWMcixw6q pic.twitter.com/xWWOw7DmZ3
‚Äî Agencia Andina (@Agencia_Andina) December 28, 2023

author: Cba24n
title: Ezequiel Delgado se qued√≥ con el primer torneo de Pesca del 2025
text:
Ezequiel Delgado se qued√≥ con el primer torneo de Pesca del 2025
Con un emocionante evento en Carlos Paz, la Federaci√≥n Cordobesa de Caza y Pesca (FECAPES) inaugur√≥ su calendario.
El pasado domingo, el Club de Pesca Renault dio inicio a la temporada 2025 con el Concurso a la Pieza de Mayor Peso, un evento que reuni√≥ a 250 pescadores en las aguas del emblem√°tico lago San Roque.
Organizado por el Club de Pesca Renault y bajo la fiscalizaci√≥n de FECAPES, el certamen dio un emocionante espect√°culo en el que se registraron 35 capturas v√°lidas.
El gran protagonista de la jornada fue Ezequiel Delgado, quien se llev√≥ el primer premio con una carpa de 5,940 kg, consagr√°ndose como el ganador absoluto del torneo.
Desde la comisi√≥n directiva del club organizador expresaron su agradecimiento a todos los participantes y colaboradores, destacando el apoyo recibido: ‚ÄúEstas son las cosas que nos animan a seguir trabajando para superarnos y tratar de mejorar en cada evento. Muchas gracias por el apoyo.‚Äù
El certamen, realizado en el Monumento Bustos, tambi√©n prioriz√≥ la inclusi√≥n, permitiendo participar a damas, cadetes y adultos con impedimentos f√≠sicos. Adem√°s, las reglas garantizaron equidad, como la prohibici√≥n del uso de multifilamento.
LO QUE VIENE:üé£üëá

author: Kevin Glenton
title: York: River Ouse has six flood warnings and rain expected | York Press
text: UPDATED: A sixth flood warning has been issued by the Environment Agency for the River Ouse at York. The agency said the area influenced is Fulford and Fordlands Road. The Environment Agency said low-lying land in the area is expected to be the most affected, particularly around riverside properties in Fulford from Blue Bridge Lane to the A64, and properties in the Fordlands Road area that can be cut-off by road flooding. FLOOD warnings have been issued for York with river levels more than double their normal levels and more rain forecast. Flood warnings from The Environment Agency ‚Äì meaning ‚Äòact now, flooding expected‚Äô ‚Äì were in place on the River Ouse before 8am this morning (Friday, December 29) due to Storm Gerrit. The agency also has issued two flood alerts ‚Äì meaning flooding is possible ‚Äì on the River Ouse. Areas with Flood Warnings The warnings are for the following parts of the River Ouse and areas influenced by rising river levels: - River Ouse at Acaster Malbis ‚Äì properties along Intake Lane, Mill Lane, Yew Tree Close, Darling Lane and Hauling Lane - River Ouse at Naburn Lock ‚Äì Naburn Lock Buildings and Lock Cottages - River Ouse at York ‚Äì properties on King‚Äôs Staith in York and riverside areas through York from Lendal Bridge to Millennium Bridge - River Ouse at York ‚Äì Skeldergate and Tower Street ‚Äì properties at lower levels on Skeldergate and on Tower Street near Tower Gardens, properties on Cumberland Street - River Ouse at York ‚Äì St George‚Äôs Field and Queen‚Äôs Staith ‚Äì properties along Queen‚Äôs Staith, on South Esplanade, Friars Terrace and Tower Place, St George‚Äôs Field carpark and Rowntree Park On the River Ouse in York, the Viking Recorder at 9.30am registered a level of 4.06 metres, more than double the top of the normal range of 1.90 metres. The Environment Agency has [updated its prediction for the peak of the Ouse level](https://www.yorkpress.co.uk/news/24015662.flood-warnings-york-alerts-north-yorkshire/) there, to 4.31 metres, on December 30 at 4am. It added that the Foss Barrier in York is in operation. A level there was recorded at 8.92 metres at 9.45am this morning, which is over a metre above the normal range. Today's Met Office weather forecast for York includes 'light showers in the afternoon'. It added that in Yorkshire and the Humber rain showers are expected overnight and will ease before Saturday. On Saturday, the Met Office forecast for York includes 'heavy rain by late morning', with conditions expected to brighten with sunny intervals by late morning on Sunday. City of York Council has said that Rowntree Park, St George‚Äôs Field Car Park, Esplanade Car Park are closed due to the high river levels. It also said flood defences are installed on Peckitt Street and Tower Gardens in York. It added that temporary footbridges are in place at Fordlands Road and City Mills. The Environment Agency flood alert said: ‚ÄúWe are monitoring rainfall and river levels, and are checking rivers for blockages in the area. ‚ÄúOur incident rooms are open and we are closely monitoring the situation. ‚ÄúWe are liaising with emergency services and local authorities. ‚ÄúConsider activating any property flood protection products. ‚ÄúAvoid using low-lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses, and do not attempt to walk, cycle or drive through water.‚Äù Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. [Read the rules here](/misc/comments)
